item.title: Amy add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Properly, we should read for power. Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Amy add a quote by Lewis Carroll
Amy add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "I do not believe that sheer suffering teaches. If suffering alone taught, all the world would be wise, since everyone suffers. To suffering must be added mourning, understanding, patience, love, openness, and the willingness to remain vulnerable." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Amy add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Amy add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I am a Woman Phenomenally. Phenomenal Woman, that's me." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Amy add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If you look for the bad in people expecting to find it, you surely will." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Amy add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Amy add a quote by Susan Cooper
item.description:
"On the day of the dead, when the year too dies, Must the youngest open the oldest hills Through the door of the birds, where the breeze breaks. There fire shall fly from the raven boy, And the silver eyes that see the wind, And the light shall have the harp of gold.
By the pleasant lake the Sleepers lie, On Cadfan’s Way where the kestrels call; Though grim from the Grey King shadows fall, Yet singing the golden harp shall guide To break their sleep and bid them ride.
When light from the lost land shall return, Six Sleepers shall ride, six Signs shall burn, And where the midsummer tree grows tall By Pendragon’s sword the Dark shall fall.
Y maent yr mynyddoedd yn canu, ac y mae’r arglwyddes yn dod." -- Susan Cooper
